Class ClientSide.Client

    public class ClientSide.Client
extends java.lang.Thread
    Since:
    2017

    Client

    Client program implements Socket Programming Client class extends the Thread class To facilitate the communication between the client and server

    1.0

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void channelWrite(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel client)
      this is the method channelWrite is use to write into the buffer whatever the clients types
      void Connect(java.lang.String hostname)
      Method Connect establish the connection between server and client Establish the connection by using PORT number of the server It sets the configuration blocking false in order to avoid blocking of communication
      void prepareBuffer(java.lang.String massg)
      The method prepareBuffer is used to write messages into the buffer
      void ReadMassage()
      the method ReadMassage is used to read the message or respond given by the server This method takes the input from server and store it into the buffer This buffer is then appended into the chatbox
      void run()
      Since the class client extends Thread hence it must override the run() method This method establish the connection between client and server by calling method Connect After establishing the connection it starts reading messages
      void SendMassage(java.lang.String messg)
      This is SendMessage method which is used to send messages to the server
